.bashrc.content:
# ~/.bashrc: executed by bash(1) for non-login shells.

export PATH=$HOME/bin:/usr/local/bin:$PATH
export PS1='researcher@ethicalhack:$PWD$ '

# WHT{basic_reconnaissance} - Start your ethical hacking journey
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'

.env.content:
# Admin Environment Configuration
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://admin:secret123@localhost:5432/app
API_KEY=sk-1234567890abcdef
# WHT{credential_discovery} - Credentials exposed!
DEBUG=true
ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@company.com

hosts.content:
127.0.0.1	localhost
127.0.1.1	ethicalhack
192.168.1.10	internal-server
192.168.1.20	db-server
# WHT{network_analysis} - Network mapping discovered
10.0.0.5	vpn-gateway

environ.content:
PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin
HOME=/root
USER=root
# WHT{process_analysis} - Process memory analysis
SECRET_KEY=process_env_secret_abc123

completion.txt.content:
Ethical Hacking Assessment Complete!
====================================

Congratulations on completing the White Hat Test!

# WHT{responsible_disclosure} - Final step complete

Remember:
- Always get proper authorization
- Document findings clearly
- Report vulnerabilities responsibly
- Respect system boundaries

You've learned the basics of ethical hacking!
